conclusion: To determine whether Car A is ahead of or behind Car B at t=10s, we need to compare the displacement of each car from t=0s to t=10s.
The displacement of an object on a v-t graph is represented by the area under the curve.
From t=0s to t=10s, Car A undergoes constant acceleration. The velocity increases linearly from 0 m/s to 40 m/s.
The displacement of Car A at t=10s (x_A(10)) is the area of the triangle formed by the v-t graph from t=0s to t=10s.
Car B undergoes constant acceleration from t=0s onwards, as its v-t graph is a straight line passing through the origin.
Car A and Car B are side by side at t=30s, meaning their total displacement from t=0s to t=30s is the same.
From t=0s to t=10s, displacement of Car A is 200 m.
From t=10s to t=30s, Car A moves at a constant velocity of 40 m/s.
Displacement from t=10s to t=30s is 40 m/s * (30 - 10) s = 40 m/s * 20 s = 800 m.
Total displacement of Car A at t=30s (x_A(30)) is 200 m + 800 m = 1000 m.
Since the two cars are side by side at t=30s, the total displacement of Car B at t=30s (x_B(30)) is also 1000 m.
Car B's motion is uniformly accelerated from rest. The displacement is given by x = 1/2 * at^2 or x = 1/2 * vt, where v is the final velocity at time t.
At t=30s, x_B(30) = 1000 m. Let v_B(30) be the velocity of Car B at t=30s.
Since Car B has constant acceleration, its velocity is proportional to time (v = at).
